docs.snippet: A reader wonders whether it’s advisable to “leave politics at the door” and say goodbye to a xenophobic relative in hospice.

headline.print_headline: Must I Visit My Dying and Dangerously Facebook-Active Uncle?
headline.main: Must I Visit My Dying and Dangerously Facebook-Active Uncle?

docs.snippet: It is also ripping apart the social fabric.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Isn’t Just Violating Our Privacy
headline.main: Facebook Isn’t Just Violating Our Privacy

docs.snippet: The social network’s employees were abuzz on Friday over a 2016 memo from a top executive, in which the executive defended Facebook’s growth at any cost.

headline.print_headline: Memo on ‘Ugly Truth’  Angers Facebook Staff
headline.main: Facebook Employees in an Uproar Over Executive’s Leaked Memo

docs.snippet: Tim Cook and Ginni Rometty have recently criticized Facebook. But don’t expect a long lineup of other tech industry leaders to speak out anytime soon.

headline.print_headline: As Facebook Struggles, Rivals Stay (Mostly) Mum
headline.main: As Facebook Struggles, Rivals’ Leaders Stay (Mostly) Mum

docs.snippet: The company’s stock has declined precipitously since hitting its peak in early February, battered by disclosures about improper use of its data.

headline.print_headline: As Facebook Loses Luster, Tech Stocks Await Fallout
headline.main: Facebook Falls From Grace, and Investors’ Stock Holdings Tumble Too

docs.snippet: If we learn anything from the recent controversies surrounding the social media giant, it should be that America’s privacy laws need beefing up.

headline.main: Facebook Is Not the Problem. Lax Privacy Rules Are.

docs.snippet: People are increasingly calling for boycotts of the big tech companies amid a backlash. The problem is that Facebook, Apple, Amazon and Google are nearly inescapable.

headline.main: They Tried to Boycott Facebook, Apple and Google. They Failed.

docs.snippet: The author of a provocative Facebook memo declaring that growth is justified even if it costs lives says he doesn't actually agree with the memo and wrote it to provoke debate.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Exec Disavows His Own Provocative Memo
headline.main: Facebook Exec Disavows His Own Provocative Memo

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it had begun "fact-checking" photos and videos to reduce the hoaxes and false news stories that have plagued the world's largest social media network.
Facebook says it is making progress weeding out fake accounts and fake news on its service as part of its efforts to prevent election interference ahead of the U.S. midterms.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Says It's Making Progress in Election Preparedness
headline.main: Facebook Says It's Making Progress in Election Preparedness
